#Text=Arthur Dent ( Puritan )
#Text=This article is about the Puritan minister and author .
#Text=For the fictional character , see Arthur Dent .
#Text=Arthur Dent ( died 1607 ) was an English Puritan cleric , known as an author and preacher .
#Text=Life
#Text=Dent was born at Melton , Leicestershire . [ 1 ]
#Text=He matriculated as a pensioner of Christ 's College , Cambridge , in November 1571 .
#Text=He graduated B.A. in 1575 – 6 , and M.A. in 1579 .
#Text=Dent served as a curate for three years to George Withers , at Danbury , Essex . [ 2 ]
#Text=He was on 17 December 1580 instituted to the rectory of South Shoebury , Essex , on the presentation of Robert Rich , 2nd Baron Rich .
#Text=In 1582 he was one of the witnesses examined in support of charges brought against Robert Wright , a Puritan minister .
#Text=About 1584
#Text=Dent himself was in trouble with John Aylmer , his diocesan bishop , for refusing to wear the surplice and omitting the sign of the cross in baptism .

#Text=His name is appended to the petition sent to the lords of the council by twenty-seven ministers of Essex , who refused to subscribe the declaration " that there is nothing contained in the Book of Common Prayer contrary to the word of God " . [ 3 ]

column1: #Text=Dent died of a fever after three days ' illness about the end of 1607 .
#Text=He left a widow .
#Text=Ezekiel Culverwell , in dedicating an edition of the Ruine of Rome to Lord Rich , remarked on Dent 's diligence .
#Text=He was considered a good preacher , and his printed sermons ran to numerous editions . [ 3 ]
#Text=Works

#Text=The plaine mans path-way to heauen : wherein euery man may clearly see , whether he shall be saued or damned : set forth dialogue wise , for the better understanding of the simple , London : imprinted for Robert Dexter , and are to be sold at the signe of the brazen serpent in Powles Church-yard , 1601 .

#Text=This was one of the two books that John Bunyan read before or during the four years of spiritual struggle that led eventually to his conversion , and his subsequent writing of Pilgrim 's Progress .
#Text=The other title was The Practice of Piety by Lewis Bayly .
#Text=The work also influenced Richard Baxter , who recast it in 1674 as The Poor Man 's Family Book .
#Text=The Ruine of Rome .
#Text=Or , An Exposition upon the whole Revelation .

#Text=Wherein is plainly shown and proved , that the Popish religion , together with all the power and authority of Rome , shall ebbe and decay still more and more throughout all the churches of Europe , and come to an utter overthrow even in this life , before the end of the world .
#Text=Written especially for the comfort of Protestants , and the daunting of Papists , Seminary Priests , Jesuits , and all the cursed rabble .
#Text=London , 1607 .
#Text=Printed by W.I. for Simon Waterson and Richard Banckworth .
#Text=The opening of heauen gates , or , The ready vvay to euerlasting life :

#Text=Deliuered in a most familiar dialogue , betweene reason and religion , touching predestination , Gods word and mans free-will , to the vnderstanding of the weakest capacitie , and confirming of the more strong
#Text=, by Aurthur Dent , London : Printed [ at Eliot 's Court Press ] for Iohn Wright , and are to be sold at his shop at the signe of the Bible without New-gate , 1624 ( fifth edition )
#Text=Sermon of Gods prouidence .
#Text=Very godly and profitable
#Text=: preached at South-Shoobery in Essex
#Text=Hand-maid of repentance .
#Text=Or , A short treatise of restitution
#Text=( As a necessary appendix to his Sermon of Repentance . )
#Text=Modern edition
#Text=The Plain Man 's Pathway to Heaven , ISBN 978-1-877611-69-8
